title: Hell.on.Wheels.S01E01.DK.ES.FR.HR.IT.PT.RO.SV.Subtitles
description:
Movie Subtitles.Croatian.Danish.French.Italian.Portuguese.Romanian.Spanish.Swedish

Set in the 1860s it centers on former confederate soldier Cullen Bohannan, whose quest for vengeance has led him to the Union Pacific Railroad's westward construction of the first Transcontinental Railroad.
The latest AMC project to come down a now-literal track is Hell on Wheels, which premiered Sunday night with a pilot episode that attempted once again to jump-start a revival of that fundamental but faded TV genre, the Western. Alas, this post-Civil War saga, about the railroading of America starring Anson Mount as a vengeful Confederate Man In Black, lacked narrative steam. 
MountÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s Cullen Bohannon is hell-bent on avenging the killing of his wife, but in the meantime, he hires onto the expanding transcontinental railroad as a foreman. He oversees laborers including Elam Ferguson, an emancipated slave played by musician-actor Common. The series is stuffed with good actors, including Colm Meaney as the corrupt rail entrepreneur (I wonÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢t be the first of you to note that MeaneyÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s Thomas Durant is a bowdlerized, wit-excised version of Deadwood and Ian McShaneÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s Al Swearengen, more the fault of the writers than of the excellent Meaney), and DamagesÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢ lanky police detective, Tom Noonan, playing a beanpole preacher here. Every character, however, is too one-note in the episodes IÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢ve seen: Common = angry; Noonan = eccentric, etc. The most promising character in the series may be Dominique McElligottÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s Lily Bell, whose attack by and escape from some Indians provided the nightÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s greatest suspense.
